# Introduction

# Bash Script

```{bash}
#!/bin/bash
# Convert all PDFs in a folder to JPGs, one JPG per page
# Requires ImageMagick installed (provides `magick` command)

input_folder="pdfs"
output_folder="jpgs"

mkdir -p "$output_folder"

for pdf in "$input_folder"/*.pdf; do
    filename=$(basename "$pdf" .pdf)
    subfolder="$output_folder/$filename"
    mkdir -p "$subfolder"

    echo "ðŸ“„ Converting $filename.pdf ..."
    
    # Convert all pages to JPGs
    magick -density 300 "$pdf" "$subfolder/${filename}_page_%03d.jpg"
    
    echo "   âœ… Saved images in $subfolder"
done

echo "ðŸŽ‰ Conversion complete!"
